shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content_distilled: Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud
shorts.title_distilled: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud.
shorts.description: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.

shorts.description: MARRIAGE LICENSE Joshua Charles Wolk and Tabay Willis, both of Taylor. PROPERTY TRANSACTIONS Nicholas Jr. and Marcia L. Demian to Lombardi & Co. Inc.; a property in Archbald for $300,000. Lloyd Van Sickle, through his duly appointed power of attorneys, Lloyd Midgett and Rosemarie Midgett, Old Forge, to Savannah June Reardon; two parcels in Old Forge for $270,000. Thomas I. Sweeney, Jermyn, to Derek Everett and Hannah Casey Tolerico, Archbald, as joint tenants with rights of survivorship; a property at 413 Gibson St., Archbald, for $325,000. Nicholas R. and Julie A. shorts.title: Dunmore High School class of 1975 50th reunion
shorts.title_distilled: Dunmore High School class of 1975 50th reunion.
shorts.description: The 50th class reunion of the Dunmore High School class of 1975 was held Sept. 7 at the Waldorf Social Club of the German American Federation on East Mountain, Scranton. Committee members, front row, from left: MaryAnn Valvano Ragnacci, Toni Manci DiVizio, Jan Dempsey Boles, Bonny Bianco Capooci, Maureen McDonald Guzzi and Jody Conway Maloney. Second row: Karen McGraw Pasqualicchio, Lou Pasqualicchio, Valerie Kolback Inman, Gene DiVizio, Susan Cannon Ditchkus, Paul Arduino, Angela Scalzo Dempsey, Linda Bliss, Marianne Sawko Chiumento, John Occhipinti and Jay Cali.
shorts.content: The 50th class reunion of the Dunmore High School class of 1975 was held Sept. 7 at the Waldorf Social Club of the German American Federation on East Mountain, Scranton. Committee members, front row, from left: MaryAnn Valvano Ragnacci, Toni Manci DiVizio, Jan Dempsey Boles, Bonny Bianco Capooci, Maureen McDonald Guzzi and Jody Conway Maloney. Second row: Karen McGraw Pasqualicchio, Lou Pasqualicchio, Valerie Kolback Inman, Gene DiVizio, Susan Cannon Ditchkus, Paul Arduino, Angela Scalzo Dempsey, Linda Bliss, Marianne Sawko Chiumento, John Occhipinti and Jay Cali.
shorts.content_distilled: 50th class reunion of the Dunmore High School class of 1975 was held Sept.

shorts.title: Clipboard, January 17, 2026
shorts.description: Clarks Summit Ice festival activities: Clarks Summit Ice Festival activities at First Presbyterian Church in Clarks Summit, weekend of Jan. 30-Feb. 1. Other than buying food in the Chili Cafe, all activities are free. The church is at 300 School St., one block off the main street. In additional to an ice sculpture on display just outside the entrance to the sanctuary, events include: Elaine Tweedy directing the photography and art show in the session room most of the weekend, featuring a juried photographic exhibit, as well as the artwork of talented parishioners and community members, Jan. 30, 4-7 p.m., […]
shorts.content: Clarks Summit Ice festival activities: Clarks Summit Ice Festival activities at First Presbyterian Church in Clarks Summit, weekend of Jan. 30-Feb. 1. Other than buying food in the Chili Cafe, all activities are free. The church is at 300 School St., one block off the main street. In additional to an ice sculpture on display just outside the entrance to the sanctuary, events include: Elaine Tweedy directing the photography and art show in the session room most of the weekend, featuring a juried photographic exhibit, as well as the artwork of talented parishioners and community members, Jan. 30, 4-7 p.m., […]
shorts.content_distilled: Clarks Summit Ice festival activities: Clarks Summit Ice Festival activities at First Presbyterian Church in Clarks Summit, weekend of Jan.

shorts.title: 5th annual 'Downtown on Ice' kicks off
shorts.description: Since 2021, downtown Scranton has celebrated the winter season with 'Downtown on Ice.' This year, 50 ice sculptures are scattered across 30 blocks in the city.
shorts.content: Since 2021, downtown Scranton has celebrated the winter season with 'Downtown on Ice.' This year, 50 ice sculptures are scattered across 30 blocks in the city.

shorts.description: Newswatch 16's Anthony Bordanaro shares how folks are taking advantage of the Lackawanna Heritage Trail despite the cold temps.

shorts.title: What to expect at this year's Ice Festival!
shorts.title_distilled: What to expect at this year's Ice Festival!.
shorts.description: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU)— There are no fears of melting ice in Scranton at this year's downtown on ice event. Streets in the center city are lined with hand-carved ice sculptures. The annual event kicks off on Friday at 6:00 p.m. 28/22 News reporter Heidi Martens has more of what the annual ice fest will offer [...]
shorts.content: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU)— There are no fears of melting ice in Scranton at this year's downtown on ice event. Streets in the center city are lined with hand-carved ice sculptures. The annual event kicks off on Friday at 6:00 p.m. 28/22 News reporter Heidi Martens has more of what the annual ice fest will offer [...]

shorts.title: Celebrating MLK Day a little early in NEPA
shorts.title_distilled: Celebrating MLK Day a little early in NEPA.
shorts.description: WILKES-BARRE, LUZERNE COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU)— Martin Luther King Day is being celebrated a little early in the Diamond City. Preparations for the national holiday are underway as the city of Wilkes-Barre held a ceremony at City Hall to launch festivities for January 19. The city welcomed the NAACP Branch 2306 in Luzerne County for the first [...]
shorts.content: WILKES-BARRE, LUZERNE COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU)— Martin Luther King Day is being celebrated a little early in the Diamond City. Preparations for the national holiday are underway as the city of Wilkes-Barre held a ceremony at City Hall to launch festivities for January 19.
